text: <@U1KFCPFQA>. thx for your information, that’s good start to let me understand this new feature. One more question, i think we also need support to encrypt the state document in couchdb, right?

In v1 the encryption story is two-fold  1) use file system encryption for data at rest  2) application can encrypt data before it is written.  Additionally, in v1 there is the concept of private chains between a subset of trusted partners, where each of the chain members has authorization to view the data, but non-members will not have the data at all.
This answer is the same for LevelDB and CouchDB state databases.
